subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
From {{inh|zh|sit-pro|-}} & related to {{cog|lus|ân||to open the mouth to receive food, to open to}} and {{m|lus|âng||to open (mouth), to gape with open mouth}}, thus {{och-l|英}} conjures the mental image of an opening flower; or of {{der|zh|aav}} origin; compare {{cog|bdq|à:ŋ||light}} ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}), from {{cog|mkh-pro|*cʔaiŋ||[[light]], to [[shine]]}}, whence also {{cog|vi|ánh||beam, ray}}.

Schuessler also points to {{cog|lus|êng||light}} and {{cog|lus|ên||to shine, to give light, bright, brilliant}}, though he suggests that these two Mizo items and Austroasiatic ones may be related to {{och-l|影|shadow}} instead ([[ibid.]])
